newsitem.title: ANTIGUA AND BARBUDA: Cricket-Rain washes out start of fourth test.
newsitem.headline: Cricket-Rain washes out start of fourth test.

text.p: India's hopes of levelling the series against the West Indies suffered a blow on Friday when rain washed out the first day of the fourth test at the Antigua Recreation Ground.
Early morning rain saturated the outfield leaving widespread pools of water. After two inspections, umpires Steve Bucknor and B.C. Cooray abandoned play for the day in mid-afternoon.
West Indies lead the series 1-0 after winning the third test in Barbados by 38 runs after India, needing only 120 to win, were bowled out for 82. The first two tests were drawn.
The home team have been bolstered by the return of captain Courtney Walsh, ruled out of the last test by a hamstring injury, in place of fast bowler Mervyn Dillon.
India have delayed naming their final 11 but it seems likely an injury to opener Navjot Sidhu will allow Venkata Laxman, originally replaced by Ajay Jadeja, to retain his place.
